III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/5/24 or 7/6/24, a female youth was in a vehicle with a staff
on a Chicago trip. Youth reported they had to use the bathroom
and even though there was a rest stop in two miles, the staff
pulled over on the road. Youth urinated in a cup on the side of the
road. Youth would have been within line of sight from the
passenger rearview window. Staff refuses to explain their actions.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone July 8, 2024. Staff 1 reported
Youth A stated on her ride back from the outing to Chicago she rode
in a van with Staff 2. Youth A reported concerns about Staff 2 making
her urinate in a plastic cup on the side of the highway when coming
back from the trip from Chicago. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 heard Youth
A make this disclosure and she sent a text message to Staff 2 about
these concerns. He reported Staff 2 did not want to talk about the
situation. Staff 1 reported Youth A did not disclose if Staff 2 saw her
urinate into the plastic cup. He reported this information to
Administrator.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 9,
2024. Youth A reported she does not like living at the facility because
she does not get along with the other youth. She reported this past
weekend, she went on a trip with staff and youth to Chicago. Youth A
reported she rode in the van with Staff 2 because she did not get
along with the other youth. She stated on the way back to the facility,
she had to use the restroom very badly and told Staff 2. Youth A
reported Staff 2 asked her if she could hold it because there was a
rest area coming up, and she stated that she had to go at that
moment. She reported Staff 2 pulled over to the side of the road on
the highway, and she urinated in a cup. Youth A reported Staff 2
gave her privacy and did not make her feel uncomfortable. She
stated that if he didn’t pull over, she would have made a mess in the
car. Youth A reported Staff 2 is a nice staff and makes her feel safe
at the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 11,
2024. Staff 2 reported he was transporting Youth A back to the
2

facility from their outing in Chicago. He reported the rest of the youth
went with other staff in the other van back to the facility. Staff 2
reported Youth A does not get along with the other youth and when
traveling back to the facility she wanted to be away from the other
youth. He reported when they were about an hour away from the
facility, Youth A began to state she needed to use the restroom. Staff
2 reported he started to look for a place where Youth A could use the
restroom and told Youth A to hold it. He stated after a few minutes
went by, Youth A said that she needed to go to the bathroom right
that moment and could not hold it in. Staff 2 reported he was just
about to get off the exit and on the off-ramp, he pulled over. He
stated Youth A got out of the car on the passenger side and he stood
outside the van on the driver's side to keep an eye on the cars driving
by. Staff 2 reported Youth A was behind the passenger side that was
the furthest away from the road and in a spot where she was not
exposing herself. He reported he tried to get a rest stop but due to
Youth A demanding to stop due to the urge to use the restroom, he
felt the need to stop. Staff 2 reported he did not want Youth A to
urinate on herself. He stated that the situation was not a great
situation to be in, but he tried to do what was in the best interest of
the youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face via Microsoft TEAMS on
July 10, 2024. Supervisor reported she directly supervises Staff 2.
She noted no reported concerns from staff or youth about Staff 2’s
job performance. Supervisor stated she was made aware of the
allegations and has talked to Staff 2 about this. She reported that in
the future there will be more mindful planning of making regular stops
to restrooms during longer car rides. Supervisor reported there is no
policy in place of what to do in a situation where a youth needs to
use the restroom and they are on a long car ride. She stated when
speaking to Staff 2, Youth A was demanding that she needed to go,
and he thought it would be better to let her go right away than have
an accident in the car.
Documents Reviewed:
- Email dated July 8, 2024, with Law Enforcement- Law
Enforcement reported a detective was not going to be
assigned for criminal investigation at this time based on the
nature of the allegations.
- Incident Report dated July 6, 2024- This incident report is
consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
- Staff 2’s Personnel File- There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 2 completed the required trainings. Staff 2
completed Supervision Policy review training on May 18,
2023, and Professional Boundaries training on March 10,
2022.
3

- Facility Supervision Policy with the most recent revision
date of July 2023- If a staff person is transporting any youth,
they must be aware of critical safety needs for the youth. If a
staff person takes a youth off-campus and they need to use
the restroom, a youth should use a single stall bathroom
whenever possible. Staff should maintain in proximity when a
youth is using the restroom off campus.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews and
documentation reviewed, Staff 2 had no malicious intent when
stopping on the side of the road for Youth A to relieve herself.
Youth A was reporting the need to use the restroom urgently and
Staff 2 gave her the privacy to do so.
Consultation:
Consultation was offered for the agency to complete restroom
stops every so often when the facility is going on a road trip.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
